text:
As a frequent traveler and local guide, I was excited to dine at Arbora in Singapore, known for its stunning views and unique ambiance. Unfortunately, my experience was anything but welcoming.

I was the only Black patron in the restaurant, and despite arriving well before some other guests, I was completely ignored for over 30 minutes. A table seated to my right after I arrived not only had their order taken promptly but even finished their meals before I decided to leave without receiving any service.

This disparity in treatment was glaring and deeply disappointing. Dining establishments should provide consistent and fair service to all patrons, regardless of their background. The scenic setting of Arbora cannot make up for the lack of inclusivity and respect I experienced during my visit.

I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and implements better training for their staff to ensure that every guest is treated with equal care and attention.
Cafe with snacks and drinks. Located at the entry for cable car at Sentosa after visiting Madam Tussads.
everything was good, just the ambience quite noisy because of other customers doesnt have any common sense?. overall quite satisfied

Tuna sandwhich tastes great, service was fast and friendly :)
Atmosphere is nice too

After fun ride at Skyluge stopby at here. This is just beside the souvenir shop with delicious  options of salads and sandwiches. Their drinks also great. You can customize your salad with dressings options. I had chicken  teriyaki with honey mustard mayo. Yumm
.. Rested a bit while having a quick lunch outdoor section with cool breezes.   and continued exploring others fun activities in Imbiah area.
